pullrequest.title: Don't include gdal headers in Dem.hh (gazebo5 API change)

content.raw:
Nice. In addition, it looks like it is also possible to remove the #include <gdal_priv.h> from gazebo/common/DemPrivate.hh. Is this something that would be a valuable addition? I imagine that DemPrivate.hh is only included in gazebo and not any external code, but moving as many #include statements out of headers as possible is good, right?

Just a thought.

EDIT: Nevermind, I suggested this without taking a full look at DemPrivate.hh, which is full of GDAL stuff. This would cause problems if the order of the #includes in Dem.cc changed in some ways.
content.html:
Nice. In addition, it looks like it is also possible to remove the #include <gdal_priv.h> from gazebo/common/DemPrivate.hh. Is this something that would be a valuable addition? I imagine that DemPrivate.hh is only included in gazebo and not any external code, but moving as many #include statements out of headers as possible is good, right?

Just a thought.

EDIT: Nevermind, I suggested this without taking a full look at DemPrivate.hh, which is full of GDAL stuff. This would cause problems if the order of the #includes in Dem.cc changed in some ways.
